name: European Food Information Council
legal: a.i.s.b.l - International non-profit association (association internationale sans but lucratif)
goal:
The European Food Information Council (EUFIC) is a non-profit organisation, established in 1995, that responds to the need for accurate and understandable information on food and health.

EUFIC's mission: To offer accessible, appealing and actionable science-based information on food and heath to inspire and empower.

EUFIC's vision: A world where people choose to live healthily because they know how to.

Information that EUFIC publishes has been subject to a review process by members of its Scientific Advisory Board (SAB, http://www.eufic.org/article/en/page/ONEUFIC/rid/eufic-scientific-advisory-board/). The SAB comprises a group of renowned experts from across Europe who advise EUFIC on its information and communication programmes, ensuring that all information is based on scientific evidence, relevance and is factually correct. EUFIC consults with other scientific experts for specific projects in areas such as consumer research and science communication. Given the broad range of subjects addressed in EUFIC’s popular newsletter, Food Today, a dedicated Editorial Board (http://www.eufic.org/article/en/page/ONEUFIC/rid/eufic-editorial-board/) for this publication provides additional insights and feedback.

With its main offices located in Brussels (Belgium), EUFIC collaborates with international, European and national organisations to enhance the impact and outreach of its communication instruments and programmes in other countries.

EUFIC actively participates in European Commission funded research projects (European Commission Directorates General for Research & Innovation), where it contributes as research and dissemination partner. EUFIC is also a member of the EU platform for action on diet, physical activity and health (DG Health and Food Safety).
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Communication, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Food Safety, Information Society, Public Health, Research and Technology
euInitiatives:
As EUFIC communicates science-based information on food and health related topics and is involved in EU-funded research projects, EU initiatives (activities, programmes, projects) and policies that fall under the remits of DG SANTE, DG AGRI, DG JRC, DG RTD, EFSA, etc., are of relevance.

The reason why EUFIC follows those initiatives and policies or legislation is to communicate about them to a wider audience. For example, EUFIC consults legislation when communicating about certain topics like:
1) food packaging (http://www.eufic.org/article/en/page/FTARCHIVE/artid/food_packaging_unwrapped/)
2) shelf-life and its importance to consumers (http://www.eufic.org/article/en/page/FTARCHIVE/artid/Food_shelf_life_and_its_importance_for_consumers/)
3) nutrition and health claims when new legislation was introduced (http://www.eufic.org/en/healthy-living/article/consumer-perception-of-nutrition-and-health-claims)
